description: Numbers n whose binary expansion starts 10.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1023
R. Stephan, Table of generating functions
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
example: 10 in binary is 1010, so 10 is in sequence.
prog: (PARI) a(n)=n+2^floor(log(n)/log(2))(PARI) is(n)=n>1 && !binary(n)[2] \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 23 2012(Haskell)import Data.List (transpose)a004754 n = a004754_list !! (n-1)a004754_list = 2 : concat (transpose [zs, map (+ 1) zs])                   where zs = map (* 2) a004754_list-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 04 2015
crossrefs: Apart from initial terms, same as A004761.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
